description.narrative: The Sustainable Agriculture Productivity Improvement Project (SAPIP), which is funded by the World Bank via The Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries (MAF) in Timor-Leste, is implemented by Oxfam in Timor-Lester (as consortia leader) and its partners (PERMATIL and KSI). SAPIP's objective is to increase the productivity and marketed production of smallholder agriculture in selected geographical locations under Belulik watershed including Ainaro and Covalima. The project objective is expected to be achieved through 4 technical components that will focus on; 1. watershed and agriculture development planning, 2. support for smallholder farmers for improved productivity, 3. reduced post-harvest loss and increased marketing of agricultural produce, and 4. institutional strengthening of MAF after a recent organisation and in anticipation of the planned decentralisation of Government services. The SAPIP project implemented by Oxfam and its partners focuses on Component 1 and 2 in the targeted municipalities.
